TopicTitle: [0.90] LazTek SpaceX Launch, Exploration, Colonial Transporter & Historic mods (1/25/14)

Articles.Content:
Great looking mod, but please reduce the memory! The Dragon capsule, by itself, slows down my system A LOT and causes the graphics and audio to stutter, even in VAB. The other parts seem to be okay, because when I remove the Dragon capsule from the rockets, there is no reduction in performance. Do we really need windows that we can see into the Dragon capsule from the outside, especially since we can't see the Kerbals in their seats anyway? I'm using the non-HD version.

EDIT:

I think I found the culprit. I removed the "Kerbal Engineer Redux" and "Engineer Redux: All Pods" mods from my system and the lag went away. The Dragon soars flawlessly now! Sorry for the mix up.

Edited October 9, 2013 by Ser Brynden
What OS are you using I used it both on win7 and win8 x64 with no issues and I am using the HD version but my system is very grunty
Thats cool as long as you found the issue now you can enjoy this mod its very nice to use and the fact that its a lander as well makes for some great exploration possibilities
Indeed - on command pods that have a lot of modules and/or tweakables, KER majorly slows things down - because it loads the Engineer module for each of them. Right click on the pod and you will see.

This mod is great, and I have a lot of use for the engines. However, even the low-res pack has some very big textures - I think the engine cluster has a 2048*2048 file, which takes up huge amounts of space. Would an "even lower res" pack be possible?
Hi will this be upgraded to .22 and use the tech tree at all
The author has not been online for a very long time, so most likely it won't be soon.
.22 Update is on its way, with science and a new inflatable habitat...
Yay, I been waiting for this to update, plus I would love a inflatable habitat.
Is it 1:1 replica, especially the engines?

.22 Update is on its way, with science and a new inflatable habitat...

Awesome, can't wait

Is it 1:1 replica, especially the engines?

No, it's scaled to the rockomax size (2.5m) parts.
How much progress have you made on the new version?
Will you also make a windowless Dragon pod for the cargo version?

Is it 1:1 replica, especially the engines?

Why? would only be useful that way to people using RSS mod....and I dont think that is the majority of the playerbase.

Why? would only be useful that way to people using RSS mod....and I dont think that is the majority of the playerbase.

Sorry pal, was just asking a question. And RSS is growing fast. Far more enjoyable and realistic with it.

Sorry pal, was just asking a question. And RSS is growing fast. Far more enjoyable and realistic with it.

You know, you could cfg edit it to be 1:1 sized. Then you could send the .cfg file to LazarusLuan, and he could include it in the mod as an alternate installation.
I wonder if this will ever get updated
The SpaceX Launch Packs v2.2 are now available on Kerbal Space Port. Please test these out and inform me of any issues you encounter.
Nice timing, 0.23 is about to come out. Tomorrow, to be specific. You might want to do an update once it's out.
No matter the timing. "I love this mod". I will wait, but would prefer not to.
Does any one know how to get get the 6 little probes out ? with out them bouncing around braking this ?

The SpaceX Launch Packs v2.2 are now available on Kerbal Space Port. Please test these out and inform me of any issues you encounter.

Awesome, thanks Laz.

The .23 update won't require an entire overhaul of everything I've created up this point, like the .22 update did. A patch for that should be faster to put out. I wish Squad would fix the spaceport before doing the .23 update, but I doubt that will happen.

Nice timing, 0.23 is about to come out. Tomorrow, to be specific. You might want to do an update once it's out.

Does any one know how to get get the 6 little probes out ? with out them bouncing around braking this ?

The SHERPA Core is a self-contained, monopropellant-fueled orbital spacecraft that SpaceX will start using next year to launch and shepherd small satellites after deploying the Dragon spacecraft. It has its own decoupler, so you simply treat it like a stage that is executed after the Dragon 2/trunk spacecraft has decoupled and it will fly directly out of the upper stage with satellites attached. The craft file for the Dragon 2 includes staging for all of these.
